page.title: 14HOUSING IN TOW LAW, DURHAM.
page.content:
{Many of the houses in and around Tow {Law, Co. Durham, were built of local {stone during the late 19th. century. {The long terraced rows have since been {extensively modernised.
During the 1950's, estates of mainly semi-detached houses were built on a number of sites. They are typical of post-war housing having pebble-dashed walls and tiled roofs.
Due to mining which had been carried out all around Tow Law few sites are now available for any future building. However a number of brick bungalows have been built where space has been available. These are mainly detached.
An old people's home with individual rooms and a communal lounge was built during the 1970's.
